poem.title: Loom
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
A red-throated diver, the jut of its jaw.
I'm weaving the waters in this old tub.
The shafts rise on the rowlocks
As I pull the oars to my bollocks.
Land ahoy, like a whiff of smoked egg plant.
Saint Brendan! With an heirloom like this,
Do you reckon it's landfall tonight?
